references.reason: This paper is foundational in multiple object tracking (MOT), establishing a widely adopted paradigm for tracking-by-detection.
This work introduced the use of transformers for object detection, which significantly impacted end-to-end MOT methods using transformers.

references.paper_title: MOTChallenge: A benchmark for single-camera multiple target tracking
references.reason: This paper introduced a benchmark dataset that has become crucial for evaluating and comparing MOT algorithms.

references.paper_title: MOTSynth: How can synthetic data help pedestrian detection and tracking?
references.reason: This paper presented a significant synthetic dataset (MOTSynth) used to train and evaluate MOT models, addressing the challenges of limited real-world data.
This work was among the first to successfully apply transformers to solve the MOT problem end-to-end.
